definitions.definition: a long flat-topped fixture in a store or bank across which business is conducted with customers.
a long flat-topped structure used for serving food and drinks in a cafeteria or bar.
a countertop.
examples: work surface, countertop, worktable; Morebar; checkout (counter) "the sugar is in a canister on the counter"Morebar; checkout (counter) the sugar is in a canister on the counter

definitions.definition: an apparatus used for counting.
examples: the counter tells you how many pictures you have taken

definitions.definition: a person who counts something, for example votes in an election.
an apparatus used for counting individual ionizing particles or events.
a small disk used as a place marker or for keeping the score in board games.
a token representing a coin.
speak or act in opposition to.
examples: the second argument is more difficult to counter

definitions.definition: respond to hostile speech or action.
examples: “What would you like me to do about it?” she countered
synonyms: confute "the second argument is more difficult to counter"

definitions.definition: give a return blow while parrying.
examples: he countered with a left hook
synonyms: retort to "workers countered accusations of dishonesty"

definitions.definition: in the opposite direction to or in conflict with.
examples: some actions by the authorities ran counter to the call for leniency

definitions.definition: responding to something of the same kind, especially in opposition.
examples: opposing, opposed, opposite a counter bid

definitions.definition: a thing that opposes or prevents something else.
examples: the stimulus to employers' organization was partly a counter to growing union power
synonyms: at odds with "nearly all of his proposals are counter to our original agreement"

definitions.definition: an answer to an argument or criticism.
examples: he anticipates an objection and plans his counter

definitions.definition: a blow given while parrying; a counterpunch.
the curved part of the stern of a ship projecting aft above the waterline.
the white space enclosed by a letter such as O or c.
the back part of a shoe or boot, enclosing the heel.
denoting opposition, retaliation, or rivalry.
denoting movement or effect in the opposite direction.
denoting correspondence, duplication, or substitution.
